a project that is a domain model (simple pojos) under src/java
the projects contains some simple junit tests as well under src/test
the plugin export just the jar file.

2.) 
a ui plugin that use the domain model objects in 1.)

3.) 
pde junit test plugin

Problem:
Until the tests are availabe in the domain model plugin thet pde junit will not lunch.
If i move the tests of the domain model plugin to the test plugin everything is working fine.

Here the stack trace.

do the plug-ins which contain the tests import the org.junit plugin in the 
plugin.xml.

I don't understand what the pde junit test plugin does?

I have 3 plugins.

1.) Domain object model plugin with some testcases inside the plugin.
2.) A eclipse UI plugin 
3.) A test plugin that is testing the UI plugin.

The 1.) plugin does not contains junit.jar in the plugin.xml. 
However the junit.jar is in the build path of this plugin and need to manually 
add until the build path is rebuilded from the plugin.xml dependencies.
 
The 2.) plugin does not contain any junit reference.
The 3.) plugin does contain the org.junit plugin as dependency in the plugin.xml

If the 1.) plugin cotains classes that extends TestCase the problems comes up.

Should i send a sample?

HTH
Stefan

Can you confirm that plugin 1) imports org.junit in its plugin.xml?

The fact the problems show up when it contains test cases indicates that this 
isn't the case.

Erich, you are right! ;)
Junit was not in the plugin.xml of the 1.) plugin.
In case i add the junit plugin to the domain model plugin (1.) the test of the ui running fine.

Strange, since the ui test plugin does not invoke any of the tests in the domain model object.
The tests was in a separate folder as well and the tests are not used in the domain model at all.
Looks like the ui test plugin tries to run all TestCase objects.

Thanks for helping, sorry for the stress.

Stefan
